@jeyhunkarimov `null` checks are only required for operators that require partitioning (like aggregates and joins). For operators like map etc, it does not matter if key is `null` or not.

The Jira is really about to get consistent behavior for joins and aggregates.

That one is less important, I think only relevant if the user has decided to unpack kafka into a path containing spaces, I'd need to check it - may be completely unnecessary 

---- On Thu, 26 Jan 2017 01:59:32 +0000 notifications@github.com wrote ----

@guozhangwang commented on this pull request.

In bin/windows/kafka-run-class.bat:

> @@ -184,7 +186,7 @@ rem echo.
 goto :eof
 :concat
 IF ["%CLASSPATH%"] EQU [""] (
-  set CLASSPATH="%1"
+  set "CLASSPATH=%1"
Just for my own benefits: why do we need to change this?


You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
+1 looks good to me
Would it be possible to add a test?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/1224/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).
Indeed it would. I will add one tomorrow morning. I rushed out this PR so that I'd have something to point to if large numbers of system tests fail tomorrow  .
Haha, OK :)

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/1223/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

Running the following hopefully a good example:
```
set "x=foo bar"
set CLASSPATH="%x%"
set "CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%x%"
echo %CLASSPATH%

set "CLASSPATH=%x%"
set "CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%x%"
echo %CLASSPATH%
```

It outputs
```
"foo bar";foo bar
foo bar;foo bar
```

@dguy @enothereska @guozhangwang

Some reformatting and simplifications. Also fixing some inconsistencies and errors.
@dguy @enothereska @guozhangwang
On `NumberFormatException`, we can wrap it as `ConfigException` and throw it back to the user.
different IMO but #2382 has improved it a lot. however one could also use a general configuration of git to avoid polluting .gitignore with IDE artifacts so I'm closing this one
@guozhangwang - i believe the test failure is unrelated.

Good point, we should throw back `ConfigException`. The existing code has a try/catch to convert from `NumberFormatException` to `ConfigException` for the string parsing cases, but it makes sense to throw `ConfigException` directly for the cases we are checking manually.

In any case, maybe that should be a separate PR as @ewencp suggested since it seems a bit controversial.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/1225/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

@harshach @junrao we are already deleting  configs and committed offsets associated with a topic. This PR deletes the associated ACLs.  Since we have separate unit tests for topic deletion and acl deletion,  I have not added any specific unit test here.  Pl review.
